docs.abstract: Bowing to public and government pressure over vaping among young people, the major tobacco company said it would take two flavor-based products off the market.
docs.snippet: Bowing to public and government pressure over vaping among young people, the major tobacco company said it would take two flavor-based products off the market.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Under pressure to curb vaping among young people, the tobacco giant Altria announced on Thursday that it would discontinue most of its flavored e-cigarettes and stop selling some brands altogether.

headline.main: Altria to Stop Selling Some E-Cigarette Brands That Appeal to Youths
headline.print_headline: Altria Jockeys For Advantage  By Dropping Flavored Vapes

docs.abstract: The agency said the “heat not burn” tobacco device was an alternative to traditional cigarettes.
docs.snippet: The agency said the “heat not burn” tobacco device was an alternative to traditional cigarettes.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Food and Drug Administration said Tuesday that it would permit the sale of IQOS, a “heat not burn” tobacco device made by Philip Morris International, in the United States.

headline.main: F.D.A. Permits the Sale of IQOS, a New Tobacco Device
headline.print_headline: U.S. Allows New Device For Tobacco

docs.abstract: Juul, the e-cigarette maker, is under intense scrutiny as vaping-related illnesses rise.
docs.snippet: Juul, the e-cigarette maker, is under intense scrutiny as vaping-related illnesses rise.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tobacco giant Altria Group said Thursday that it had devalued its investment in the vaping company Juul Labs by $4.5 billion, a move that reflects deepening turmoil in the e-cigarette industry.

headline.main: Juul’s Meltdown Costs Tobacco Giant Altria $4.5 Billion
headline.print_headline: Big Investor In Juul Loses $4.5 Billion Amid Crisis

docs.abstract: Altria and Philip Morris International are in talks to recombine as they confront slowing cigarette sales and competition from e-cigarettes.
docs.snippet: Altria and Philip Morris International are in talks to recombine as they confront slowing cigarette sales and competition from e-cigarettes.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. We’re back from our break a little earlier than expected. Here’s today’s news. (Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up here.)

headline.main: DealBook Briefing: Can Two Tobacco Giants Save Themselves by Merging?

docs.abstract: Juul needs good science to prove to the F.D.A. that its e-cigarettes offer more benefits than risks. Some researchers say they are loath to take the company’s money.
docs.snippet: Juul needs good science to prove to the F.D.A. that its e-cigarettes offer more benefits than risks. Some researchers say they are loath to take the company’s money.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Alex Carll was presenting his research about the impact of e-cigarette smoke on mouse hearts at an American Heart Association conference when a man from Juul Labs approached him and started asking questions.

headline.main: Scientists Wanted: Recruited by Juul, Many Researchers Say No
headline.print_headline: Scientists Balk At Juul’s Offers Of Study Cash

docs.abstract: Companies and trade groups are weighing the risks of fighting a proposed ban on most flavored vaping products, to protect mint and menthol varieties.
docs.snippet: Companies and trade groups are weighing the risks of fighting a proposed ban on most flavored vaping products, to protect mint and menthol varieties.
docs.lead_paragraph: A ban on flavored e-cigarettes would not only severely dent sales of Juul Labs’ popular vaping products, but also have a chilling effect on the little-regulated $2.6 billion industry of roughly 20,000 vape and smoke shops that sprang up across the country in the past few years.

headline.main: A Ban on Flavored E-Cigarettes Would Sharply Cut Sales
headline.print_headline: Ban on Flavored Vapes Would Jolt an Industry

byline.original: By Julie Creswell and Sheila Kaplan

docs.abstract: Juul and Big Tobacco have lobbied for months to protect themselves from aspects of the F.D.A.’s crackdown. As Scott Gottlieb leaves, they see an opening.
docs.snippet: Juul and Big Tobacco have lobbied for months to protect themselves from aspects of the F.D.A.’s crackdown. As Scott Gottlieb leaves, they see an opening.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Scott Gottlieb became commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration in 2017 with an ambitious plan to reduce cigarette smoking, a habit that kills nearly half a million Americans each year, by shifting smokers to less harmful alternatives like e-cigarettes.

headline.main: Tobacco and E-Cigarette Lobbyists Circle as F.D.A. Chief Exits
headline.print_headline: Tobacco Lobby Seizes Opening In Exit at F.D.A.

byline.original: By Sheila Kaplan and Matt Richtel

docs.abstract: Seeking re-election to a seventh term, the senator cited the rise in teenage vaping as a reason to curtail sales of tobacco and other products.
docs.snippet: Seeking re-election to a seventh term, the senator cited the rise in teenage vaping as a reason to curtail sales of tobacco and other products.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Mitch McConnell, long one of the tobacco industry’s loyal allies, said on Thursday that he would sponsor legislation to raise the minimum age to 21 for the purchase of tobacco and e-cigarettes.

headline.main: Senator McConnell, a Tobacco Ally, Supports Raising Age to Buy Cigarettes
headline.print_headline: McConnell Backs ‘Tobacco 21’ Bill. Others Question Fine Print.

docs.abstract: With marijuana becoming legal in more markets, big corporations are swooping in with multibillion-dollar deals.
docs.snippet: With marijuana becoming legal in more markets, big corporations are swooping in with multibillion-dollar deals.
docs.lead_paragraph: Proponents of legal marijuana spent decades fighting a slow battle for mainstream acceptance. Now, with recreational use legal in Canada and many states in the United States, big business is suddenly swooping in.

headline.main: When the Makers of Marlboro and Corona Get Into Marijuana
headline.print_headline: This Is the Dawning of the Age of Pot Inc.

docs.abstract: A deal between the e-cigarette start-up and Altria, the maker of Marlboros, would create a powerful partnership in marketing and lobbying.
docs.snippet: A deal between the e-cigarette start-up and Altria, the maker of Marlboros, would create a powerful partnership in marketing and lobbying.
docs.lead_paragraph: E-cigarette maker Juul, which has vowed to make cigarettes obsolete, is near to inking a deal to become business partners with Altria, one of the world’s largest tobacco companies.

headline.main: Juul May Get Billions in Deal With One of World’s Largest Tobacco Companies
headline.print_headline: Juul May Get Billions From a Tobacco Giant

byline.original: By Matt Richtel and Sheila Kaplan
